alert.note: Alert for Manitowoc (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 05 at 11:48PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Wisconsin, including the following county, Manitowoc. * WHEN...Until 300 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1145 PM CST, Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen from rain that fell throughout the evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Two Creeks, Two Rivers, Mishicot, Larrabee, Cooperstown, Maple Grove, Francis Creek, Hickory Grove, Maribel, Kellnersville, Melnik, Reifs Mills, Fisherville, Rosecrans, Zander, Taus and Menchalville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
